title: 6 Home Renovation Apps to Help you Get the Job Done
text:
Rooomy is a virtual staging platform that lets you really see how furniture will look in your space. rooomy.com

Remodeling your home can be a headache. Whether it’s finding a reputable construction crew or simply deciding on the style of your rooms, there’s so much to think about. But that’s where some handy home renovation apps come in.



From figuring out floor plans and locating nearby experts to finding decor inspiration, here is your guide to some of the best apps out there.

More: A Guide to Smart Garage Gadgets

Magicplan

www.magicplan.app

With Magicplan, you can become your own architect. The app helps you figure out the ideal floor plan simply by using your smartphone or tablet. It turns the device’s camera into a scanner that gives you the power to draw a plan with your fingertips or import existing floor plans. It captures and displays all the necessary measurements you need to make the plan come to life. You can account for and add things such as windows, electrical outlets and doors. You can even estimate the cost of your new floorplan, since the app automatically computes fees based on materials such as tiles, flooring and paint as well as data.



Magicplan starts at $2.99 per month.



Handy

www.handy.com

Handy finds available pros in your area to handle tasks from cleaning and moving to TV mounting and electrical services. The service vets (and does a background check on) all the pros in their database, so you don’t have to worry about who is showing up to your home. You can also set a fixed price ahead of time so there won’t be any surprise hidden fees that crop up. The app is available in more than 20 cities and allows users to book and manage appointments, view professional profiles and ratings and see your pro’s location in real time.

The Handy app is free for iOS devices.

Tap Painter

TapPainter

Visualizing what paint colors will work in your home is a little like figuring out if an article of clothing will fit without trying it on. It’s difficult. But TapPainter is an app that lets you virtually test paint your walls. Simply snap a photo of a room you want painted, tap the wall in question, and it will create a digital mockup. It takes light, shadows and wall edges into account so you can see an accurate picture of the hue you choose. Try on colors from big brands like Benjamin Moore, Behr and Sherwin Williams.



The Handy app is free for iOS devices.

Rooomy

It’s one thing to have your heart set on a pink Hollywood Regency-style sofa, but imagining how it will actually look (or fit) in your space is another story. Meet Rooomy, an app that’s basically a virtual staging platform that lets you really see how furniture will look in your space. Using a 2-D photo of your room, the app converts it into a 3-D model and enables you to view specific pieces from major retailers in different configurations within a virtual space. Then, you can buy what you like from affiliated retailers such as Amazon, Pottery Barn and Wayfair via direct links.

Rooomy is free for iOS devices.

iHandy Carpenter

iHandy Group

For the DIYer, the ihandy Carpenter app turns your phone into a toolkit. It includes five essential functionalities for measuring and decorating: A plumb bob to verify the verticality of lines or walls, a surface level, a bubble level bar, a steel protractor, which measures angles from 0 to 180 degrees, and a steel ruler configured in both inches and centimeters (you can even measure things longer than your phone by swiping). Hanging art has never been this accurate.



iHandy Carpenter is $1.99.



Photo Measures

www.cubent.com

How many times have you been in a furniture store, eyeing what looks like the perfect piece only to realize you don’t know the dimensions of the room it would go in. By downloading Photo Measures, you can actually write the dimensions of every wall, corner and cranny right onto a photo of the room itself. By storing and organizing your photos according to category, you’ll never have to guess if something will in fact fit in your space again.



Photo Measures is $6.99.
